ISSUE.TITLE: handle quote tweets
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: granary currently renders [quote tweets](https://support.twitter.com/articles/20169873) with just the quoted tweet URL, which isn't great. e.g. [this tweet](): is rendered as: > Python everywhere! [twitter.com/obrizan/statusâ€¦](https://twitter.com/obrizan/status/658583490468945920) i'm not sure how we should render them, but ideally we'd fully render the quoted tweet's text, mentions, links, etc. quote tweets can be [identified by the `quoted_status_id` field](https://dev.twitter.com/overview/api/tweets). very lightly related to snarfed/bridgy#504.
